content:
### EXISTING STRUCTURES

#### Electricity generator at position(-1.5, 4.5)
Consists of 
- Offshore pump at position(-9.5, -0.5)
- Boiler at position(-6.0, 1.5)
- Steam engine at position(-1.5, 4.5)
- Pipe group connecting offshore pump to boiler 
  - Pipe at position(-8.5, -0.5)
  - Pipe at position(-7.5, -0.5)
  - Pipe at position(-7.5, 1.5)
  - Pipe at position(-7.5, 2.5)
  - ... other pipes connecting to boiler and steam engine
- Small electric poles connecting steam engine to electric mining drill at position(15.5, -0.5) and other entities

#### Coal mine at position(15.5, -0.5)
Consists of 
- Electric mining drill at position(15.5, -0.5)
- Wooden chest at position(15.5, 1.5) to collect coal

#### Crude oil extraction and processing at position(17.5, 40.5)
Consists of 
- Pumpjack at position(17.5, 40.5)
- Storage tank at position(22.5, 42.5)
- Oil refinery at position(28.5, 45.5)
- Chemical plant at position(35.5, 45.5)
- Pipe group connecting pumpjack to storage tank and oil refinery
  - Pipe at position(18.5, 38.5)
  - Pipe at position(19.5, 38.5)
  - Pipe at position(20.5, 38.5)
  - Pipe at position(21.5, 39.5)
  - Pipe at position(31.5, 42.5)
  - Pipe at position(30.5, 42.5)
  - Pipe at position(32.5, 43.5)
  - ... other pipes connecting to oil refinery and chemical plant
- Small electric poles connecting steam engine to pumpjack, oil refinery, and chemical plant

### ERROR TIPS
- Errors when inspecting the inventory of an entity
  - Ensure that the entity has an inventory and that it is properly initialized before attempting to inspect it.
- Errors when connecting entities with pipes
  - Ensure that the source and target connections points are not blocked and the target is able to receive the fluid from the source.
- Errors when placing entities at occupied positions
  - Ensure that the target location is not occupied by another entity or part of the terrain is not unplaceable.
- Errors when using incorrect prototype names
  - Ensure that the correct prototype name is used (e.g., 'pipe-to-ground' instead of 'underground-pipe' or incorrect attribute access like 'Prototype.PipeToGround').
  - Specifically, use 'pipe-to-ground' instead of 'underground-pipe)
- Errors when electric mining drill, pumpjack, or oil refinery is not receiving electricity
  - Ensure that these entities are connected to a power source and that the power source is functioning.
- Errors when boiler is out of fuel
  - Ensure that the boiler is supplied with fuel (e.g., coal) to continue functioning.
- Errors when attempting to place pipe-to-ground at an occupied location
  - Ensure that the target location for pipe-to-ground is not occupied by another entity.
- Errors when steam engine is not connected to power network
  - Ensure that the steam engine is connected to other entities that require power.
- Errors when oil refinery or chemical plant is experiencing fluid ingredient shortage
  - Ensure that the oil refinery or chemical plant is supplied with the required fluids to continue functioning.
- Errors when accessing non-existent attributes of an object
  - Ensure that the attribute exists for the object before attempting to access it (e.g., 'ElectricityGroup' object has no attribute 'neighbours').
- Errors when using undefined variables
  - Ensure that all variables are defined before using them (e.g., 'to' is not defined, 's' is not defined, 'entity' is not defined).
- Errors when using incorrect operand types
  - Ensure that the correct operand types are used for the operation (e.g., bad operand type for unary -: 'type').
- Errors when checking connections between pumpjack and storage tank or oil refinery
  - Ensure that the pipe connections between pumpjack and storage tank or oil refinery are properly established and not blocked.
- Errors when using 'Prototype.PipeToGround' instead of correct attribute name
  - Ensure that the correct attribute name is used (e.g., the correct attribute name is 'pipe-to-ground', the agent should use the correct Prototype name).
- Errors when using unsupported connection types
  - Ensure that the connection
